page.title: 20 B.D.FUELS.
page.content: B.D.Fuels have been on the Hixon Industrial Estate for 7 years.The initials B.D.stand for the names of the two directors,Barker and Davies.They chose Hixon because it was convenient to the Stafford area.They have no more depots in the country.B.D.Fuels have 4 tankers(each having the capacity of 2500 gallons)and 12 men. They supply both the domestic and commercial sectors;and deliver in a 30 mile radius.They tend to sell more oil in the winter months. B.D.Fuels have an excellent safety record. The oil is purchased from Texaco.It is refined in Pembroke and they transport it via a pipeline to the Kingsbury terminal near Birmingham.From here it is taken to Hixon.
